frontmatter.description: Part 3 | Exploring packages in R using data collected as part of the EU funded 'Collaborative research and development of green roof system technology' project.
frontmatter.title: Interactive Visualisations in R

frontmatter.description: In this blog post I'm going to talk about data visualisation - making graphs - within c++ programs. I'll describe why you might want to do this and I'll try to justify why I've spent a sizeable part of my time over the last couple of years developing graphing code in c++, rather than using Python or R like everyone else!
frontmatter.title: Data visualisation in c++ with computational models

frontmatter.description: Part 2 | Exploring packages in R using data collected as part of the EU funded 'Collaborative research and development of green roof system technology' project.
frontmatter.title: Static Visualisations in R

frontmatter.description: Part 1 | Exploring packages in R using data collected as part of the EU funded 'Collaborative research and development of green roof system technology' project.
frontmatter.title: Data Processing for data visualisations in R

frontmatter.description: There are a lot of things to learn when you make a transition from Excel to R, especially if you haven't touched programming languages before, everything can be overwhelming and frustrating. Hopefully this article will help you make a smooth transition.
frontmatter.title: Moving from Excel to R

frontmatter.description: Data visualizations have effects. If we don’t stop to think about data visualizations' social role and the people who engage with them, they may not have the impact that their producers intend.
frontmatter.title: Data Visualization’s Social Role

frontmatter.description: As researchers and practitioners we also need to be conscious of the wider social impact which can arise from visualising data and consider how to do so responsibly.
frontmatter.title: With great power comes great responsibility - challenges in visualising data

frontmatter.description: A simple introduction to D3.js (Data-Driven Documents) - a powerful Javascript Library for creating interactive data visualisation in web browers by manipulating Document Object Model (DOM).
frontmatter.title: D3.js for data visualisation

frontmatter.description: A shiny dashboard that lets users explore the relationship between socio-cultural and GM-attitudinal measures described in Mallinson et.al. (2018) - Why rational argument fails the genetic modification (GM) debate.
frontmatter.title: Visualising GM data with a Shiny dashboard

frontmatter.description: A selection of visualisation templates for you to build a visualisation more quickly.
frontmatter.title: Visualisation templates for Python

frontmatter.description: The Jupyter Notebook has become a very popluar web application for sharing and creating documents  that contain live code, equations, visualisations and narrative text. This article put together a  number of user-friendly pathways for running live, interactive Jupyter notebooks on the web, and  documentation on how to use it.
frontmatter.title: Hosting Jupyter Notebook

frontmatter.description: Helen Kennedy is Professor of Digital Society at the University of Sheffield. Her research traverses digital landscapes. She is especially interested in the datafication of everyday life.
frontmatter.title: Simple data visualisations have become key to communicating about the COVID-19 pandemic, but we know little about their impact.
